verses.verse: My son, <WH1121> give <WH7181> attention <WH7181> to my wisdom, <WH2451> Incline <WH5186> your ear <WH241> to my understanding; <WH8394>
That you may observe <WH8104> discretion, <WH4209> And your lips <WH8193> may reserve <WH5341> knowledge. <WH1847>
For the lips <WH8193> of an adulteress <WH2114> drip <WH5197> honey, <WH5317> And smoother <WH2509> than <WH4480> oil <WH8081> is her speech; <WH2441>
But in the end <WH319> she is bitter <WH4751> as wormwood, <WH3939> Sharp <WH2299> as a two-edged sword. <WH2719>
Her feet <WH7272> go <WH3381> down <WH3381> to death, <WH4194> Her steps <WH6806> lay <WH8551> hold <WH8551> of Sheol. <WH7585>
She does not ponder <WH6424> the path <WH734> of life; <WH9132> Her ways <WH4570> are unstable, <WH5128> she does not know <WH3045> [it].
Now <WH6258> then, [my] sons, <WH1121> listen <WH8085> to me, And do not depart <WH5493> from the words <WH561> of my mouth. <WH6310>
Keep <WH7368> your way <WH1870> far <WH7368> from her, And do not go <WH7126> near <WH7126> the door <WH6607> of her house, <WH1004>
Lest <WH6435> you give <WH5414> your vigor <WH1935> to others, <WH312> And your years <WH8141> to the cruel <WH394> one; <WH394>
Lest <WH6435> strangers <WH2114> be filled <WH7646> with your strength, <WH3581> And your hard-earned goods <WH6089> [go] to the house <WH1004> of an alien; <WH5237>
And you groan <WH5098> at your latter <WH319> end, <WH319> When your flesh <WH1320> and your body <WH7607> are consumed; <WH3615>
And you say, <WH559> "How <WH349> I have hated <WH8130> instruction! <WH4148> And my heart <WH3820> spurned <WH5006> reproof! <WH9640>
"And I have not listened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of my teachers, <WH4175> Nor <WH3808> inclined <WH5186> my ear <WH241> to my instructors! <WH3925>
"I was almost <WH4592> in utter <WH3605> ruin <WH9563> In the midst <WH8432> of the assembly <WH6951> and congregation. <WH5712>"
Drink <WH8354> water <WH4325> from your own cistern, <WH953> And fresh <WH5140> water <WH5140> from your own well. <WH875>
Should your springs <WH4599> be dispersed <WH6327> abroad, <WH2351> Streams <WH6388> of water <WH4325> in the streets <WH7339>?
Let them be yours alone, <WH905> And not for strangers <WH2114> with you.
Let your fountain <WH4726> be blessed, <WH1288> And rejoice <WH8055> in the wife <WH802> of your youth. <WH5271>

[As] a loving <WH158> hind <WH355> and a graceful <WH2580> doe, <WH3280> Let her breasts <WH1717> satisfy <WH7301> you at all <WH3605> times; <WH6256> Be exhilarated <WH7686> always <WH8548> with her love. <WH160>
For why <WH4100> should you, my son, <WH1121> be exhilarated <WH7686> with an adulteress, <WH2114> And embrace <WH2263> the bosom <WH2436> of a foreigner <WH5237>?
For the ways <WH1870> of a man <WH376> are before <WH5227> the eyes <WH5869> of the Lord, <WH3068> And He watches <WH6424> all <WH3605> his paths. <WH4570>
His own iniquities <WH5771> will capture <WH3920> the wicked, <WH7563> And he will be held <WH8551> with the cords <WH9112> of his sin. <WH9128>
He will die <WH4191> for lack <WH369> of instruction, <WH4148> And in the greatness <WH7230> of his folly <WH200> he will go <WH7686> astray. <WH7686>
